name: Limpsfield common and the Carpenters Arms Walk, Harewoods

ai.summary: A challenging 15.2 km circular hike that links Limpsfield Common with the Carpenters Arms Walk at Harewoods, weaving through heathland, mixed woodland and rural lanes with several gentle ascents and rewarding views.
ai.terrain_summary: Terrain combines heathland and woodland: wide bridleways, narrow paths, grassy climbs and occasional tarmac. Expect muddy stretches after rain, uneven footing, and several stiles and gates. The route features some moderate ascents with occasional short, steep sections and open exposed ground for views.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for UK weather and daylight; check forecasts and start times. Tell someone your route and estimated finish. Wear sturdy footwear and weather-appropriate clothing; waterproofs recommended. Be mindful of livestock on common land and keep dogs under control. Carry a map or GPS and a charged phone; start early in winter due to shorter daylight. In wet or icy conditions, expect slower progress and potential slip hazards.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Waterproof and windproof jacket with layered clothing
Map and compass or GPS device (and a charged phone as backup)
Small first aid kit and whistle
Sun protection (hat and sunscreen) for sunny days
Walking poles (optional but helpful on long ascents)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to Autumn are ideal; winter hikes are possible with extra caution due to mud and shorter daylight hours.

seo.title: Limpsfield Common and the Carpenters Arms Walk – 15.2 km Hard Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore Limpsfield Common and Harewoods on a 15.2 km challenging circular hike. Heathland and woodland trails with elevation and scenic views—ideal for experienced hikers in the UK.
